item.description:
Lake Massabesic is a beautiful, wooded area in Southern New Hampshire with long fire roads and maintained trails great for hiking, snowshoeing and cross country skiing. We may have a choice depending on the weather and conditions. The Audubon rents snowshoes ($8.00) if conditions are right. YakTracx on hiking boots may also be an option. If you are interested in cross country skiing let me know in your reply and I can setup a group for skiing and one for hiking. We will start out at the NH Audubon and head for Battery Point, about a 2 1/2 mile round trip. We can make it longer by taking some side trails as we did on the last hike.

For those interested we will meet at the Ye Olde Post Restaurant for breakfast (great omelets) at 10:00am. If your not doing breakfast meet at the restaurant at 11:30am. The trip to Lake Massabesic from there is short - or -

If you want to go right to the NH Audubon the directions are:
NH RT 93 North to exit 5 State Hwy 28 (Rockingham RD)
Take a right at the end of ramp
go 300 feet and take a left turn onto Auburn Road (by the Poor Boy Restaurant)
Go 2 miles then continue on Beaver Brook Rd.
Turn left at Londonderry Turnpike (By-Pass 28)
go 2.6 miles and right turn at Spofford Rd
Aububon Way is on the left, we will meet at the NH Aububon Center around 11:45am (after the breakfast) and start the trip at 12:15pm.

Directions to Ye Old Post restaurant in Chester, NH:
NH RT 93 to exit 4, State Hwy 102
East on RT 102 toward Derry
Travel three miles and at the traffic circle, take the 3rd exit onto Chester Rd/RT 102, Continue to follow RT 102
6 miles from the traffic circle at the intersection of RT102 and RT 121 (blinking yellow light) take a left
The "Ye Olde Post" is on the left next to the hardware store.

I made it a limit of 10 for the restaurant only because it is small restaurant. I would like to hold it to 20 for the hike, One group of skiers, one group hikers/snowshoes.

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Hike/Snowshoe/Crosscountry ski Lake Massabisic In Auburn, NH
